alert.note: Alert for Orange County Coastal (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 25 at 1:55AM PST until February 25 at 4:00AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...All of Orange County, the Riverside and San Bernardino County Mountains, the Inland Empire, and the San Gorgonio Pass Near Banning. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A winter storm will bring period of heavy rain today. Rain rates of 0.50 to 0.75 inches per hour are expected this morning. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
